description.narrative: The PDO is to: (a) strengthen transport planning; (b) improve transport efficiency and safety on the Babadjou-Bamenda section of the Yaounde - Bamenda transport corridor; and (c) enhance safety and security at selected airports.

condition.narrative: FA, Schedule 2, Section I. A. 4: For purposes of Parts 2 of the project. the Ministry of Defense shall, through the PSU, beresponsible for providing security for the works and sites along the Matazem-Bamenda and the Bamenda hill up station by-passsections of the road in accordance with the provisions of the Collaboration Framework Agreement and the Security Management Plan.

FA, Schedule 2, Section I. H, (1): The Borrower shall ensure that each contract entered into for the implementation of the Projectcontains appropriate safeguards for the management of the security risk resulting from conflicts in the areas where the activitiesunder such contract are carried out.

FA, Schedule 2, Section I. H, (2): The Borrower, through the Ministry of Defense, shall ensure that in carrying out the works alongthe Matazem-Bamenda and the Bamenda hill up station by-pass sections of the road, that PSU’s personnel and any Military Personnelassigned to guard the works, comply with the security arrangements and the code of conduct set forth in the Collaboration FrameworkAgreem

FA, Schedule 2, Section I. H, (3): For the avoidance of doubt, and without limitation upon the Borrower’s other obligations underthis Agreement, the Borrower further undertakes that no Financing proceeds or resources may be used for security and militarypurposes or for any payments made to the PSU.

FA, Schedule 2, Section I. I (a): The Borrower shall (i) cause the Ministry of Public Works and the Ministry of Defense to maintainthe collaboration agreement (the “Collaboration Framework Agreement) setting forth the respective roles and responsibilities ofeach such ministry with respect to the engagement of PSU’s Personnel and detailing the arrangements and procedures for thedeployment of the

FA, Schedule 2, Section I. I (b): The Borrower shall not amend, abrogate, waive or otherwise modify the Collaboration FrameworkAgreement, or permit the Collaboration Framework Agreement or any provision thereof to be amended, abrogated, waived or otherwisemodified, except with the prior written agreement of the Bank. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of theCollaboration Framew

FA, Schedule 2, Section K (1): Prior to commencement of any works, the Borrower shall establish, publicize, maintain at all timesduring the rehabilitation of the Matazem-Bamenda and the Bamenda hill up station by-pass sections of the road, and operate anaccessible GRM for the purpose of receiving grievances on alleged harm, or misconduct by PSU’s Personnel or any Military Personnel,or any occur

FA, Schedule 2, Section L (1): The Recipient shall take all necessary actions to enable the TPM NGO to perform its activities inaccordance with the applicable terms of reference, including but not limited to allowing and facilitating the TPM NGO to visit andmonitor the Project Area, collect relevant data and communicate with Project stakeholders and beneficiaries.

Finance Agreement :Annual Work Plans and Budgets, Schedule 2, Section I, E, 1 | Description :Not later than November 30 in eachcalendar year (or one month after the Effective Date for the first year of Project implementation), the Borrower shall prepare orcause to be prepared for the purpose of forwarding to the Bank, a draft annual work plan and budget for the Project (includingTraining and Operating Costs) for the subsequent calendar year of Project implementation, of such scope and detail as the Bankshall have reasonably requested. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Counterpart Funding - Designated Accounts, Schedule 2, Section V, A (1) | Description :Maintain, throughout theimplementation of the Project, in a financial institution and on terms and conditions acceptable to the World Bank, an account intowhich it shall deposit all counterpart funds required for Parts 2(b)(ii), 3(a)(v) and 4(b) of the Project ("Counterpart FundsAccount"). | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Counterpart Funding - Eligible Expenditures, Schedule 2, Section V, A (3) | Description :Ensure that all amountsdeposited in the Counterpart Funds Account be used exclusively to pay for Eligible Expenditures required for the relevant parts ofthe Project. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Counterpart Funding - Schedule and Installments, Schedule 2, Section V, A (2) | Description :Without limitationupon the provisions of Section 5.03 of the General Conditions, on a schedule and in installments agreed with the World Bank, butnotlater than thirty-six (36) months after the Effective Date, deposit into the Counterpart Funds Account, an amount in theBorrower's currency, equivalent to fourteen million seven hundred thousand Dollars (US$14,700,000) ("Counterpart Funds"). | DueDate :27-Jan-2020

Finance Agreement :Financial Management, Schedule 2, Section II, B, 4 | Description :In furtherance of the provisions of thisSection II.B of Schedule 2 to this Agreement and not later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, the Borrower shall, andshall cause the CCAA to, adapt or establish as the case may be, for the purposes of the project, its computerized multi-projectfinancial and accounting system in a manner satisfactory to the World Bank, and successfully train relevant staff in the usethereof. | Due Date :27-Mar-2017

Finance Agreement :Output performance-based contract, Schedule 2, Section V, C | Description :For purposes of Section 5.06 (b) ofthe General Conditions, the Recipient shall, not later than thirty-six (36) months after the Effective Date, enter into a ten(10)-year output performance-based contract with a qualified contractor for the maintenance of the Yaounde-Bamenda corridor. | DueDate :27-Jan-2020

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Manual, Schedule 2, Section I, D, 1 | Description :No later than two (2) months after theEffective Date, the Borrower shall update the Project Implementation Manual in a manner satisfactory to the World Bank and shallcarry out the Project in accordance with said Project Implementation Manual and except as the World Bank shall otherwise agree, theRecipient shall not assign, amend, abrogate, or waive the Project Implementation Manual, or any provision thereof. | Due Date:27-Mar-2018

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Unit - Recruitment of qualified/experienced personnel | Description :Without limitationupon the provisions of Paragraph (a) of Section I.A.2 of this Schedule 2, the Project Implementation Unit shall at all times becomprised of qualified and experienced personnel in adequate numbers, and to this end, inter alia, no later than two(2) monthsafter the Effective Date, recruit a junior procurement specialist and an environmental specialist and a social specialist, all withqualifications and terms of reference acceptable to the World Bank. | Due Date :27-Mar-2018

Finance Agreement :Tax waiver applicable to eligible expenditures, Schedule 2, Section V, B | Description :Without limitations uponthe provisions of Section 5.03 of the General Conditions, the Recipient shall waive any and all Taxes, applicable to all EligibleExpenditures under the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Road transport efficiency improvement: Progress in improving physical road condition on the project road section between Babadjou and Bamenda
Social infrastructure improvement: Number of existing water systems rehabilitated or extended
Airport safety improvement: Project-implemented AGA Corrective measures validated by ICAO-monitored missions
Relevant government officials trained in transport planning (Number, Custom)
Road safetyimprovement: Accident black spots removed on the project road section between Babadjou and Bamenda
Road Transportefficiency improvement: Market sheds built for road side vendors on the project road section between Babadjou and Bamenda
Road Transport efficiency improvement: Secondary roads reconstructed
Improve road asset management: km of road maintained under OPBC along the project road between Babadjou and Bamenda
Road Transport efficiency improvement: Roads rehabilitated
Air transport security Improvement: Annex 17 project-implemented corrective measures validated by ICAO-monitored missions
Citizen engagement consultations carried out on a bi-annual basis with participation from project beneficiaries
Road transport efficiency improvement: Average time by a Twenty Foot Equivalent Unit (TEU) on the project road section between Babadjou and Bamenda
Airport safety Improvement: ICAOâ€™s EI rating of Aerodrome and Ground Assistance (AGA) at project airports
Road safetyimprovement: Annual road accidents recorded along the project road between Babadjou and Bamenda
Air transport Security Improvement: ICAOâ€™s Average rating of Cameroonâ€™s air security oversight system
Progress made by CCAA towards certifying at least one of the identified airports in conformity with ICAO SARPs

target.value: Third audit completed and certification request submitted to ICAO

title.narrative: Transport PlanningImprovement: Progress in applying Multimodal Transport Benchmarks (MTBs) to TPIP and DSCE 2 (Text, Custom)

target.value: MTBs mainstreamed in DSCE 2 and applied to the first PTIP

title.narrative: Transport Planning Improvement: Progress in adopting the first Transport Priority Investment Program (TPIP)

target.value: Consultations on and adoption/use of first PTIP completed
